sudo apt-get install --reinstall php5-co: didn't change anything with the module activation problem.
did you generate a php.ini file by yourself?
the php.ini file was copied from a working debian system.
what ubuntu version are you running?
there are php.ini-production files. should i use them?
after copying the production file to /etc/php5/apache2/php.ini and restarting apache, a search for "gd" in my phpinfo() output still shows up nothing.
i used the init script itself, but still no change ;)
on the debian system there are a number of files for the different plugins, apparently.
give me a minute to copy them and try again.
sudo apt-get purge php5-gd; sudo apt-get install php5-gd
thanks a lot! that did it.
have a nice day. also thanks to airtonix and HermanDE.
